title: Boffa 2015  Barbaresco
description: This opens with varietal aromas of strawberry, new leather and tobacco. The savory palate offers crushed raspberry, clove and white pepper alongside solid, fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2021–2030.

title: Castell 2016 Casteller Kugelspiel Erste Lage Trocken Silvaner (Franken)
description: While hints of crushed stone and wild herb are demure on the nose, fresh white peach, quince and tangerine are bold and fruity in this dry white. It's light bodied yet silky, with a lingering green herb finish.

title: Castello d'Alba 2015 Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: A wine that is dominated by old-vine Touriga Nacional, it comes from vineyards in the Douro Superior. Its powerful tannins are reinforced by the immense black fruits and dry core from wood aging. This is not a wine from the faint-hearted. Drink from 2020.

title: Cusumano 2017 Alta Mora Bianco  (Etna)
description: Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit and crushed herb delicately drive the aromas. Reflecting the nose, the fresh, savory palate delivers juicy yellow pear, lemon zest, wild sage and a graphite note. A saline note perks up the linear finish.

title: Cuvaison 2016 Mariafeld Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Light cranberry and strawberry flavors show impressive depth and breadth in this full-bodied expressive wine. Cola and cinnamon provide spicy seasoning that melds well with the fruit, the entirety textured in layers of velvety softness.

title: Devona 2015 Mount Richmond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: As Devona wines are still produced in Walla Walla, these single vineyard efforts bear only the generic Oregon AVA on the label. This Elk Cove vineyard is now part of Devona's single vineyard lineup. Principally Pommard clone, it spent time in 30% new French oak, adding scents of toast and cigar box to the mix. The cherry fruit also has a tobacco flavor component, and the firm, smooth tannins finish with a touch of black tea.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This estate white is full of crushed rock and wet stone elements that blend with tones of apple, oak and salt. Light bodied and restrained, it shows a wealth of structure and aging potential. Enjoy 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

title: Dunning Vineyards 2015 Reserve Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Dark cherry and boysenberry aromas meet with a hint of anise on the nose of this bottling from Paso Robles' Westside. Flavors of strawberry compote and boysenberry paste are lifted by clove and gingerbread on the rich palate.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light aromas of black raspberry, cranberry jam and a hint of oak smoke kick off the nose in this study of a popular clone. The smoky elements mask the fruit at first on the sip, but ripe berries and mulberry slowly arise alongside the charred pork flavors, bolstered by a long-simmering acidity.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Feudi Studi Candriano  (Taurasi)
description: French oak, mature plum and exotic spice aromas form the nose. The palate is tight and primary, offering sour cherry, cranberry, espresso and a hint of bitter cocoa alongside drying, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Don't even attempt until after 2025.

title: Foxen 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lighter in the glass, this appellation blend shows pomegranate sorbet, cranberry skins, rose petals and wild herbs on the nose. The palate is crisp and tart with raspberry fruit that's lifted by chaparral spice and wild thyme.

title: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Rosso Passorosso  (Etna)
description: Woodland berry, smoke, wild rose and Mediterranean scrub lead the way on this vibrant red. Racy and succulent, the savory, focused palate delivers juicy strawberry, red cherry, star anise and chopped herb alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. A saline note gives it a tangy finish. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Grace + Vine 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied aromas of ripe cherry meet with dark wild herbs and a hint of cedar on the nose of this bottling from a secret dream team of regional vintners. The wood element shows on the sip, where flavors of red plum and mulberry are lifted with fennel frond and herbal spices.

title: Grgich Hills 2016 Fumé Blanc Estate Grown Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A grip of reduction on the nose in tones of flint and matchstick is consistent for the producer's style. On the palate are light-bodied layers of green olive, pineapple, peach and lemon, a contrasting set of fruit and savory elements that work seamlessly together.

title: Irene Badalà 2017 Santo Spirito Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Aromas of Spanish broom, orchard fruit, baked bread and wild herb form the nose. On the full-bodied palate, fresh acidity lifts raspberry compote, candied orange zest, and a hint of pastry cream. The finish lends a tangy mineral note evoking oyster shell.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy, seductive and soft, this well-made wine offers tones of forest floor, pomegranate and strawberry. It delivers plenty of flavor beneath a delicately crafted body.

title: J. Wright 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Firmly anchored in black fruits, this is the current release (mid-2018). Details include black olive and coffee grounds, lightly applied, and the wine shows impressive depth and flavor persistence. It's truly a reserve-level Pinot at an entry-level price.

title: J Wrigley 2016 828 Single Clone Estate Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Firm and precise, this pushes tart cranberry/raspberry fruit up front, with a seam of citrus oil and rind. Grapefruit highlights and lemony acidity flow into a lingering finish, with a comet's tail of chocolate.

title: Johannishof 2017 Johannisberg V Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)
description: There's an earthy complexity to this Kabinett, suggesting notes of smoke, dried earth and candle wax melding into brighter tones of tangerine and lemon. Light on its feet and delicately honeyed, it finishes on lingering bolts of lemon and lime acidity.

title: LaRue 2014 Rice-Spivak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Succulent and bright, this interweaves crunchy red fruit into a cohesive whole of balanced freshness and high-acid tenacity, the tannins supportive in providing weight and grip.
